title: userEsk
description: A `userEsk` entity is used for userEsk classification or categorization. It is a term defined under `userEskClassification` entity. UserEsks are used to label the entities and entity fields, such as Tables, and Columns.

id.description: Unique identifier of this entity instance.

displayName.description: Display Name that identifies this userEsk.

fullyQualifiedName.description: Unique name of the userEsk of format `userEskClassification.userEsk1.userEsk2`.

userEskClassification.description: Reference to the userEsk classification that this userEsk is part of.

parent.description: Reference to the parent userEsk. When null, the term is at the root of the userEsk Classification.

updatedAt.description: Last update time corresponding to the new version of the entity in Unix epoch time milliseconds.

href.description: Link to the resource corresponding to the userEsk.

usageCount.description: Count of how many times this userEsk and children userEsks are used.

deleted.description: When `true` indicates the entity has been soft deleted.

changeDescription.description: Change that lead to this version of the entity.

disabled.description: System userEsks can't be deleted. Use this flag to disable them.

mutuallyExclusive.description: Children userEsks under this group are mutually exclusive. When mutually exclusive is `true` the userEsks from this group are used to **classify** an entity. An entity can only be in one class - example, it can only be either `tier1` or `tier2` and not both. When mutually exclusive is `false`, the userEsks from this group are used to **categorize** an entity. An entity can be in multiple categories simultaneously - example a customer can be `newCustomer` and `atRisk` simultaneously.
